humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: Based on the pathology report, there were no positive lymph nodes found in the axillary dissection. The report mentions 'Twelve benign lymph nodes (0/12)' for the additional level II dissection and 'Three benign lymph nodes (0/3)' for the level II and III dissection. This indicates that none of the assessed lymph nodes had metastatic carcinoma. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N0, as per New Rules 10 and 11.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has a total of 15 lymph nodes examined, with 0 out of 12 positive in the first set of level 1 and low level 2 axillary contents, and 0 out of 3 positive in the second set of level 2 and level 3 axillary contents. However, there is extranodal tumor extension (>2 mm) in one or more lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage is N2.
